resources.string:
Audio Mashup is intended to interact with multiple sound files to create your own beats or even just to use as a standard soundboard.

 Snipper: Use this to create smaller clips of original sound files in your current possession. Currently supports WAV and MP3.

 Edit Mode: Here is where you can edit the playback options for each button. Through the menu, you can navigate to any other options.

 Start: This is where the magic happens. Selecting the buttons will now play a song if preloaded. Hit "Record" in the menu to start recording your tracks.
 

 Recorder: Record your voice or nearby sounds by using your phones mic. Recorded sounds are saved to /sdcard/Custom Soundclips

 NOTE
 Moving between Start....Edit can be done through the menu options

 All Audio Mashup files generated will be saved to Custom SoundClips.

 Author: Jordan Brobyn
 Contact Info: jordanbrobyn@hotmail.com


Please feel free to provide feedback/issues or suggestions to the email above!

Instructions:
 1. Select a mp3 or wav file using 'Browse'
 2. Select a start time and end time to cut from
 3. (optional) sample the song using the play button
 4. Press 'Save' to add a new clip to '\Custom SoundClips\
